data.description: Explores emerging built environments designed to support people undergoing crises such as disasters, conflicts, forced migration. Focuses on psycho-social components to employ human-centered design lens to environments of crisis. Examines theoretical frameworks on stress, trauma-informed practices, supportive environments, and restoration. Investigates physical spaces in crisis environments and their health and wellbeing impacts. Evaluates design, policy interventions from lenses of equity and justice, human rights, and dignity.
data.title: ENVIRONMENTS OF CRISIS & DESIGN
